Instruction: In a separate bowl, cream the butter and sugar until smooth. Mix in the syrup and eggs. In another bowl, sift together the flour, salt, cinnamon, ginger, allspice, and cloves; incorporate this dry mixture into the butter mixture and knead until it forms a stiff dough. Shape into a flat circle and wrap in wax paper. Chill for a minimum of 2 hours.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly browned. Remove from the oven and allow to cool on wire racks.
Bake in the preheated oven until the edges turn golden brown, approximately 10 minutes. Let cool to room temperature before serving.
